metadata.title: CVE-2020-27418 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A Use After Free vulnerability in Fedora Linux kernel 5.9.0-rc9 allowsattackers to obatin sensitive information via vgacon_invert_region()function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27418` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-99-generic - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-4.15.0-99-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-4.15.0-99-lowlatency - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-99-generic - 4.15.0-99.100
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-99-lowlatency - 4.15.0-99.100
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-37-lowlatency - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-37-generic - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-37-lowlatency - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1059-kvm - 4.15.0-1059.60
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1066-aws - 4.15.0-1066.70
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1020-aws - 5.4.0-1020.20~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1082-azure - 4.15.0-1082.92
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1022-azure - 5.4.0-1022.22~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-gcp - 4.15.0-1071.81
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1021-gcp - 5.4.0-1021.21~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1010-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1038-oracle - 4.15.0-1038.42
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1021-oracle - 5.4.0-1021.21~18.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-99.100').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1').
